# brain

<!-- badges: start -->
<!-- badges: end -->

`{brain}` currently ships a single function `read_brain()`, which reads in MRtrix3 TCK file format `.tck` and returns a list of length two containing header information as well as a list of matrices representing streamlines. The function is written in base R and comparable fast. 

## Installation

You can install the development version of `{brain}` like so:

``` r
devtools::install_github('FBrockmeyer/brain')
```

No CRAN. 

## Example
```{r example}
tck_files = list.files(path='path/to/folder', pattern='.tck$', full.names=TRUE)
L = lapply(tck_files, brain::read_brain) |> setNames(basename(tck_files))
```
